justification:
China is the global leader in Layer 1: Power & Electricity, ranking #1 in both total generation and installed capacity. 
- **Industrial Capacity**: In 2023, China generated approximately 9,300 TWh (EIA), with capacity reaching 3,400 GW in 2024 (EIA). 
- **Cost Efficiency**: Industrial electricity prices are highly competitive, ranging from $0.088 to $0.114/kWh (China Briefing, GlobalPetrolPrices). 
- **Clean Mix**: As of 2024, the generation mix includes 58.2% coal, 13.5% hydropower, 9.8% wind, 8.3% solar, and 4.4% nuclear (Ember, LowCarbonPower). While coal remain significant (58.2%), the low-carbon share (approx. 38%) is growing faster than any other nation. 
- **Grid Reliability**: National SAIDI has improved to approximately 7.11 hours (426 minutes) in 2023, with major industrial/urban centers achieving much higher reliability (often <1 hour). 
- **National Output Percentile**: Rank #1 globally, accounting for roughly 30% of world electricity generation. 
Sources: 
- EIA: https://www.eia.gov/international/content/analysis/countries_long/China/ 
- Ember: https://ember-energy.org/countries-and-regions/china/ 
- GlobalPetrolPrices: https://www.globalpetrolprices.com/China/electricity_prices/ 
- IRENA: https://www.irena.org/News/pressreleases/2025/Mar/Record-Breaking-Annual-Growth-in-Renewable-Power-Capacity
